news_header: The Chaplin Office in Paris manages Charlie Chaplin's legacy, overseeing copyrights, licensing, and memorabilia nearly 47 years after his death.
news_text: The Chaplin Office, located in Paris, is dedicated to preserving and managing the legacy of film legend Charlie Chaplin, who was born in England, worked in Hollywood, and spent his later years in Switzerland. This organization oversees various rights-holding companies that handle Chaplin's archives, trademarks, and film copyrights, all controlled by the Chaplin family. Arnold Lozano, the current managing director, balances respecting the family's wishes while promoting Chaplin's work globally. The office also engages in licensing deals, merchandising, and copyright enforcement. With the copyright protections for Chaplin's films set to expire in 2047, the Chaplin Office is focused on preserving his work for future generations, ensuring that his universal message continues to resonate with audiences worldwide.
